channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gustavo Gutiérrez, Father of Liberation Theology, Dies at 96
item.description: Once considered revolutionary, his notion of empathy and advocacy for the poor has become a central tenet of Catholic social teaching.

item.title: Deadly ‘Terrorist Attack’ on Turkish Aerospace Company Leaves 4 Dead and 14 Injured
item.description: Turkey’s interior minister said it was “most probably” the Kurdistan Worker’s Party that carried out the assault on the sprawling Turkish Aerospace In...

item.title: Student demand for an MBA is surging—but that might be bad news for the U.S. economy
item.description: An overwhelming majority of full-time MBA programs experienced application growth but that means students are worried about the job market.

item.title: G7 Finalizes $50 Billion Ukraine Loan Backed by Russian Assets
item.description: The economic lifeline is expected to be disbursed by the end of the year.

item.title: There are good reasons for couples to keep their finances separate, experts say
item.description: "We’re shifting more toward a world where it’s more common and comfortable to not join finances, and that’s okay."

item.title: Boeing’s new CEO says the company will be ‘iconic’ again—even after losing more than $6 billion last quarter
item.description: CEO Kelly Ortberg outlined “fundamental” changes to the aircraft manufacturer ahead of Wednesday’s earnings.

item.title: What CIOs and other tech leaders are prioritizing as they plan their 2025 budgets
item.description: Artificial intelligence is at the top of the list for what tech leaders are planning to spend on in 2025.

item.title: A Feathered Murder Mystery at 10,000 Feet
item.description: Scientists say they have observed one of the highest-altitude acts of bird predation ever recorded.

item.title: Live Updates: Blinken Pursues Regional Tour as Mideast Conflict Deepens
item.description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken sought to ease tensions on a visit to Israel, followed by a meeting with the Saudi crown prince in Riyadh. Israel...

item.title: U.S. Says North Korean Troops Are in Russia to Aid Fight Against Ukraine
item.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III called the situation “very, very serious,” though he said that what the soldiers were doing in Russia was “left ...

item.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook didn’t know you could name group chats on your iPhone
item.description: Cook has been CEO of Apple for more than a decade.

item.title: California Tribal Casinos May Sue to Curb City Card Rooms
item.description: A new state law allows tribes to file suit against gambling venues they don’t operate, potentially shuttering them and jeopardizing local tax revenue.

item.title: Deadly ‘Terrorist Attack’ on Turkish Aerospace Company Leaves 4 Dead and 14 Injured
item.description: Turkey’s interior minister said it was “most probably” the Kurdistan Worker’s Party that carried out the assault on the sprawling Turkish Aerospace In...

item.title: Israeli Military Fires on Ancient City of Tyre in Lebanon
item.description: Hours after issuing evacuation orders, Israel took aim at Tyre, an ancient port city in Lebanon, in the military’s ongoing campaign against Hezbollah.

item.title: G7 Finalizes $50 Billion Ukraine Loan Backed by Russian Assets
item.description: The economic lifeline is expected to be disbursed by the end of the year.
